59 /* This class is pure virtual so that I can hide its implementation from its users. It will be
60  referenced in plugins, but implemented in the runtime.
61 
62  However, virtual methods cannot be templated, so these templated methods refer to a virtual
63  method whose type has been erased (coerced to/from void*). This is an instance of the Non-Virtual
64  Interface pattern: https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/More_C%2B%2B_Idioms/Non-Virtual_Interface
65 */

134  template <typename event>
135  void schedule(std::string name, std::function<void(const event*)> fn) {
136  _p_schedule(name, [=](const void* ptr){ fn(reinterpret_cast<const event*>(ptr)); }, typeid(event).hash_code());

146  template <typename event>
147  std::unique_ptr<writer<event>> publish(const std::string& name) {
148  auto void_writer = _p_publish(name, typeid(event).hash_code());
149  return std::move(std::unique_ptr<writer<event>>(reinterpret_cast<writer<event>*>(void_writer.release())));
150  }

162  return std::move(std::unique_ptr<reader_latest<event>>(reinterpret_cast<reader_latest<event>*>(void_writer.release())));
163  }
